title: Flip-Flops
subject: Computer Organization
theory:
Fundamental unit of memory. Stores 1 Bit. 
- **Latch**: Level Triggered. 
- **Flip-Flop**: Edge Triggered (Clock). 
- **D-FF**: Data (Stores input). Most common in CPU design. 
- **JK-FF**: Toggles.

common_mistakes.correction: Latches cause race conditions. Edge-triggered Flip-Flops are used to separate stages.

interview_questions.question: Difference between Latch and Flip-Flop?
interview_questions.answer: Latch checks input constantly (Level). Flip-Flop checks only at clock edge (Edge).
